a.title: Next School Board Listening Time is 4/20/2020

div.a: Next School Board Listening Time is 4/20/2020
div.div: The next School Board Listening Time is Monday, April 20, 2020 from 6 p.m. to 6:50 p.m. Your input is welcomed and valued even more during this unprecedented time. The School Board Listening Time protocol has been adjusted; please see below for more information.

a.title: Robbinsdale Area Schools Provide Resources to Families Experiencing Housing Instability

div.a: Robbinsdale Area Schools Provide Resources to Families Experiencing Housing Instability
div.div: Various departments within Robbinsdale Area Schools are working together to provide meals and educational materials to highly-mobile families, including those experiencing homelessness. Nutrition Services, Transportation and Student Services are collaborating to connect with these families, as well as determining what resources are needed and getting those resources delivered.

a.title: School Staff Create Virtual ‘Calming Room’ to Provide Social-Emotional Support, Resources

div.a: School Staff Create Virtual ‘Calming Room’ to Provide Social-Emotional Support, Resources
div.div: With many students and families adjusting to a “new normal” during the COVID-19 global pandemic, it is especially important to find ways to cope and relax. Counseling staff at Cooper High School, and counselors and the school social worker at Sandburg Middle School, created online spaces for students, staff and families to find tools and strategies for managing their social-emotional health.

span.style: margin: auto; padding: 0px; line-height: normal; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
line-height: normal; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

span.span:
(Independent School District 281) is an award-winning district committed to academic excellence. We take pride in the choice we have provided to our families and students for nearly a century. We serve all or parts of seven communities with more than 100,000 residents in the northwest suburbs of Minneapolis, Minn.
Armstrong High School has been ranked 6th on the Minnesota section of the "Most Challenging High Schools" list, formerly published by the Washington Post, for 2018 and Cooper made the list at number 25. We are very pleased to see recognition of the excellence of these two schools. Read more about these prestigious rankings here.
Cooper High School also made Newsweek's "Beating the Odds List of Top 500 High Schools!" Cooper was also ranked number 7 out of high schools from the state of Minnesota. Read more here.
